definition: honorific title for a Buddhist monk

sentences.english: Zen master had a faithful but very naive student who regarded him as a living buddha.

sentences.english: The Zen master Hakuin was praised by his neighbors as one living a pure life.
sentences.chinese: Hakuin被他的邻居称赞为一个一生纯洁的禅师。

sentences.english: While the master quietly served tea, the professor talked about Zen.

sentences.english: In Tokyo in the Meiji era there lived two prominent teachers of opposite characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 明治时代的东京住着两位性格截然不同的禅师。

sentences.english: The Zen master will lead the Lakers once more.

sentences.english: So the father decided to call on a Buddhist monk to train his boy.

sentences.english: After the child was born it was brought to Hakuin.

sentences.english: The Vietnamese monk, Thich Nhat Hanh has a very good commentary on the Heart Sutra.
sentences.chinese: 越南的一行禅师，著有一本《心经》的很好的注释。

sentences.english: A professor once visited a Japanese master to inquire about Zen.
sentences.chinese: 一位教授前去和一位日本的禅师探讨禅意。

sentences.english: Joshu asked, “Have you eaten your rice porridge?

sentences.english: Thank Master Xuefeng contribute this essay.
sentences.chinese: 感谢雪峰延承禅师提供本文。

sentences.english: The Zen teacher Thich Nhat Hanh has turned his attention to how Buddhism could help ecology. Photograph: AP

sentences.english: I'm not looking to get in any war of words with Phil Jackson.
